asgn2CarParks

Class CarPark

  • java.lang.Object
    • asgn2CarParks.CarPark

  • public class CarPark
extends java.lang.Object
    The CarPark class provides a range of facilities for working with a car park in support of the simulator. In particular, it maintains a collection of currently parked vehicles, a queue of vehicles wishing to enter the car park, and an historical list of vehicles which have left or were never able to gain entry. The class maintains a wide variety of constraints on small cars, normal cars and motorcycles and their access to the car park. See the method javadoc for details. The class relies heavily on the asgn2.Vehicle hierarchy, and provides a series of reports used by the logger.
    Author:
    hogan

      • CarPark

        public CarPark()
        CarPark constructor sets the basic size parameters. Uses default parameters

      • CarPark

        public CarPark(int maxCarSpaces,
       int maxSmallCarSpaces,
       int maxMotorCycleSpaces,
       int maxQueueSize)
        CarPark constructor sets the basic size parameters.
        Parameters:
        maxCarSpaces - maximum number of spaces allocated to cars in the car park
        maxSmallCarSpaces - maximum number of spaces (a component of maxCarSpaces) restricted to small cars
        maxMotorCycleSpaces - maximum number of spaces allocated to MotorCycles
        maxQueueSize - maximum number of vehicles allowed to queue

    • Method Detail

      • archiveDepartingVehicles

        public void archiveDepartingVehicles(int time,
                            boolean force)
                              throws VehicleException,
                                     SimulationException
        Archives vehicles exiting the car park after a successful stay. Includes transition via Vehicle.exitParkedState().
        Parameters:
        time - int holding time at which vehicle leaves
        force - boolean forcing departure to clear car park
        Throws:
        VehicleException - if vehicle to be archived is not in the correct state
        SimulationException - if one or more departing vehicles are not in the car park when operation applied

      • archiveNewVehicle

        public void archiveNewVehicle(Vehicle v)
                       throws SimulationException
        Method to archive new vehicles that don't get parked or queued and are turned away
        Parameters:
        v - Vehicle to be archived
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if vehicle is currently queued or parked

        public void archiveQueueFailures(int time)
                          throws VehicleException
        Archive vehicles which have stayed in the queue too long
        Parameters:
        time - int holding current simulation time
        Throws:
        VehicleException - if one or more vehicles not in the correct state or if timing constraints are violated

        VehicleException - if vehicle not in the correct state

      • exitQueue

        public void exitQueue(Vehicle v,
             int exitTime)
               throws SimulationException,
                      VehicleException
        Method to remove vehicle from the queue after which it will be parked or removed altogether. Includes transition through Vehicle.exitQueuedState.
        Parameters:
        v - Vehicle to be removed from the queue
        exitTime - int time at which vehicle exits queue
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if vehicle is not in queue
        VehicleException - if the vehicle is in an incorrect state or timing constraints are violated

      • finalState

        public java.lang.String finalState()
        State dump intended for use in logging the final state of the carpark All spaces and queue positions should be empty and so we dump the archive
        Returns:
        String containing dump of final carpark state

        number of cars in car park, including small cars

        Returns:

      • getNumSmallCars

        public int getNumSmallCars()
        Simple getter for number of small cars in the car park
        Returns:
        number of small cars in car park, including those not occupying a small car space.

      • getStatus

        public java.lang.String getStatus(int time)
        Method used to provide the current status of the car park. Uses private status String set whenever a transition occurs. Example follows (using high probability for car creation). At time 262, we have 276 vehicles existing, 91 in car park (P), 84 cars in car park (C), of which 14 are small (S), 7 MotorCycles in car park (M), 48 dissatisfied (D), 176 archived (A), queue of size 9 (CCCCCCCCC), and on this iteration we have seen: car C go from Parked (P) to Archived (A), C go from queued (Q) to Parked (P), and small car S arrive (new N) and go straight into the car park
        262::276::P:91::C:84::S:14::M:7::D:48::A:176::Q:9CCCCCCCCC|C:P>A||C:Q>P||S:N>P|
        Returns:
        String containing current state

      • initialState

        public java.lang.String initialState()
        State dump intended for use in logging the initial state of the carpark. Mainly concerned with parameters.
        Returns:
        String containing dump of initial carpark state

      • numVehiclesInQueue

        public int numVehiclesInQueue()
        Simple status showing number of vehicles in the queue
        Returns:
        number of vehicles in the queue

      • parkVehicle

        public void parkVehicle(Vehicle v,
               int time,
               int intendedDuration)
                 throws SimulationException,
                        VehicleException
        Method to add vehicle successfully to the car park store. Precondition is a test that spaces are available. Includes transition via Vehicle.enterParkedState.
        Parameters:
        v - Vehicle to be added
        time - int holding current simulation time
        intendedDuration - int holding intended duration of stay
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if no suitable spaces are available for parking
        VehicleException - if vehicle not in the correct state or timing constraints are violated

      • processQueue

        public void processQueue(int time,
                Simulator sim)
                  throws VehicleException,
                         SimulationException
        Silently process elements in the queue, whether empty or not. If possible, add them to the car park. Includes transition via exitQueuedState where appropriate Block when we reach the first element that can't be parked.
        Parameters:
        time - int holding current simulation time
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if no suitable spaces available when parking attempted
        VehicleException - if state is incorrect, or timing constraints are violated

      • queueEmpty

        public boolean queueEmpty()
        Simple status showing whether queue is empty
        Returns:
        true if queue empty, false otherwise

      • queueFull

        public boolean queueFull()
        Simple status showing whether queue is full
        Returns:
        true if queue full, false otherwise

      • spacesAvailable

        public boolean spacesAvailable(Vehicle v)
        Method determines, given a vehicle of a particular type, whether there are spaces available for that type in the car park under the parking policy in the class header.
        Parameters:
        v - Vehicle to be stored.
        Returns:
        true if space available for v, false otherwise

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • tryProcessNewVehicles

        public void tryProcessNewVehicles(int time,
                         Simulator sim)
                           throws VehicleException,
                                  SimulationException
        Method to try to create new vehicles (one trial per vehicle type per time point) and to then try to park or queue (or archive) any vehicles that are created
        Parameters:
        sim - Simulation object controlling vehicle creation
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if no suitable spaces available when operation attempted
        VehicleException - if vehicle creation violates constraints

      • unparkVehicle

        public void unparkVehicle(Vehicle v,
                 int departureTime)
                   throws VehicleException,
                          SimulationException
        Method to remove vehicle from the carpark. For symmetry with parkVehicle, include transition via Vehicle.exitParkedState. So vehicle should be in parked state prior to entry to this method.
        Parameters:
        v - Vehicle to be removed from the car park
        Throws:
        VehicleException - if Vehicle is not parked, is in a queue, or violates timing constraints
        SimulationException - if vehicle is not in car park
